heading: Sunday Night
text: Scattered snow shower south of Route 4, otherwise mostly cloudy. Accumulations between 1-3 inches in the south, less than an inch in central Vermont. Lows in the mid to low teens and single digits in the ADK and cold hollows.

heading: Monday (MLK Jr. Day)
text: Periods of clouds, an increasing chance of snow showers from the west through the afternoon. Highs from the low 20s north, increasing to near 30 as you head south. Light wind turning southwest, gusting up to 20 mph.

heading: Monday Night
text: Partly cloudy and snow showers continuing with the highest chances in the north. Lows in the single digits, below zero in the cold hollows.
